name: Priscilla Railey
text:
Very rushed visit . Dr. did not listen to me at all.  Waited over an hour for less than 2 minutes of actual Dr. patient time. Prescribed medication for migraine headaches and wasn't even there for headaches.
Very rude atmosphere.

name: Charlie Caulder
text: I was pleased with the visit with Dr. Kesserwani.  It was very thorough and answered all my questions.

name: Tracy Underwood
text: The staff were very easy to work with. Pleasant and helpful at all intervals.  Dr Kesserwani is a great doctor and it was a great first visit in efforts to find the cause of my mother's condition and begone begin treatment plan.

name: Robert Davis
text:
The Doc is working on being one of us the good ol boy's...
Very competent Dr. K would recommend him if you need a neurologist. But you may have to wait for your appointments before getting one..

name: Holly Reynolds
text: I took my mother to Dr K. The staff was extremely friendly. Dr K was awesome. He was considerate and answered all of my questions.

name: Luretha Hampton
text: The doctor is great first and foremost! There was a situation that arose while I was sitting in the waiting room that an office manager should have handled privately but the office manager did not even bother to come out and speak to the patient instead kept running the receptionist back and forth between the office manager and the person. The person who came in the office was saying things that did not need to be heard in the waiting room by other patients she should have been taken to the back and talk to privately. Not very professional!. Also the receptionist was making phone calls to patients about appointments and so forth, but every word could be heard by everybody in the waiting room. That is not much patient confidentiality.

name: Jenni Ingram
text: I was treated with kindness, understanding and professionalism by everyone in the office.  Dr. Kesserwani knew exactly what I was talking about and what tests he want me to have. Amazing experience.

name: Nina Stokes
text: I was worked into his Friday schedule before a three day weekend. The office was very busy. I did have to wait but that was understandable. Dr. K listened carefully to my concerns and did some tests in his office. He set up an EEG, a MRI, and a tilt test within the next couple of weeks. I picked up a heart monitor the next day at the hospital. They already had my orders so I didn't have to worry about any paperwork. Overall I received excellent care from Dr. K.

name: B H
text: Good visit!  Had heard different things going in, but he had a good bed side manor with my dad!

name: Lynn Peters
text: Dr.Kesserwani is certainly a professional!  He truly cares about his patients, he talks to them and makes them more comfortable.  I would definitively recommend this DR.!

name: Allan Kimble
text: Dr. Kesserwani  takes the time to introduce and explain new treatments that are available.  He is very responsive to patient reports of symptoms and ensures testing is ordered to provide data for appropriate treatment.

name: jeanette glover
text: It was a very good visit with my Doctor.  All the office Personnel were very nice and also the Nurses.  I will be going back in three months.

name: Amber Young
text: They are very caring and they keep up with your health and patient they believe in helping you and your situation in any way that they can. They also listen to your problem and try to come up with the best way they can help you. I feel this is the best place that helped me over the years of other places

name: Dennis Rowe
text: I am a new patient with doctor K. He came a cross to me as being interested in caring for me and will do further testing at my next appointment. I am looking forward to getting helped and my next appointment.

name: CHARLOTTE KIRKLAND
text: Very kind and considerate office personnel. Dr. Kesserwani seems to understand and want to treat the illness. People go to the specialist's office, many times, on one of the most frightening days of their lives. I think a lot of physician's staff as well as the physicians themselves forget that. It's good to find a group of people that have not forgotten that fact. Thank you!

name: Lawana Grant
text: This doctor is very direct and to the point. He doesn’t like a lot of chitchat just the nitty-gritty which could be different for some patients  but very positive for others. He is also very thorough.

name: Marilyn Scott
text: He was great. Very thorough and explained the reason for my pain. Thsnk you for your attentiveness.

name: Ashanti Lewis
text: Nice and friendly staff. The Doctor is comedian.  He is so nice and friendly.  I love a doctor who makes you feel relaxed and yourself around them.  I'm glad th hat he's my neurologist.

name: Beverly Vick
text: I’ve always been very pleased with the care of Dr. Kesserwani and his staff are kind and curious.  I would recommend them to my friends for sure.

name: Felecia Thompson
text: I enjoyed my visit with Dr. Kesserwani. He is very hands on and determined to find out what is going on with his patients

name: Deshawna Fields
text: I was sent to Dr. Kesserwanni due to dizziness, and other issues, he was able to determine the cause.  He is very straightforward when speaking with you, but I am glad he was able to tell me what the issue I had been having for the past 4-5 months was.

name: Misty Cook
text: Staff is always friendly. And appt times are average, no long wait. Phone system was messed up there. Had tried to call about 16 times before heading to the office. No answer when called. Had a card with a one appt and then I get text with different appt, was trying to verify before I had drive my Mom over 2 hours to see dr. But mostly staff is friendly. Some times I feel as we are rushed with doctor.

name: Faye Brant
text: Very quick to get me in as a new patient 🤗 With having severe headaches he and his staff were eager to figure out what medication and treatment would work best for myself... highly recommend

name: Mike Hussey
text:
Everyone was very friendly and helpful
Dr. Kesserwani was very professional and helpful

name: Carol Sheppard
text: He was very polite, professional and very thorough! Excellent bedside manner! I liked him a lot......

name: Martha Gordon
text: I am always amazed at Dr Hassan Kesserwani’s genuine concern to resolve my health issues. No, he doesn’t spend a lot of time during my visit with chitchat because he spends his time to discussing my issues. He is knowledgeable, experienced, considerate and frankly right-down-to-business, plus, he explains “why and what” I should know. My kind of doctor! He does not hesitate to send me to another specialist to get further information  that he then uses to diagnose and compile a treatment plan. I have spent 11 years dealing with stroke symptoms, blood disorder and neuropathy with four  other neurologists but until now, none have taken aggressive or preventive measures like dr Kesserwani. For sure, when I am dealing with life and death issues I want him by my side!

text: I was sent to Dr. Kesserwanni due to dizziness, and other issues, he was able to determine the cause.  He is very straightforward when speaking with you, but I am glad he was able to tell me what the issue I had been having for the past 4-5 months was.

text: Staff is always friendly. And appt times are average, no long wait. Phone system was messed up there. Had tried to call about 16 times before heading to the office. No answer when called. Had a card with a one appt and then I get text with different appt, was trying to verify before I had drive my Mom over 2 hours to see dr. But mostly staff is friendly. Some times I feel as we are rushed with doctor.

text: Very quick to get me in as a new patient 🤗 With having severe headaches he and his staff were eager to figure out what medication and treatment would work best for myself... highly recommend

name: Mike Hussey
text:
Everyone was very friendly and helpful
Dr. Kesserwani was very professional and helpful

name: Carol Sheppard
text: He was very polite, professional and very thorough! Excellent bedside manner! I liked him a lot......

name: Martha Gordon
text: I am always amazed at Dr Hassan Kesserwani’s genuine concern to resolve my health issues. No, he doesn’t spend a lot of time during my visit with chitchat because he spends his time to discussing my issues. He is knowledgeable, experienced, considerate and frankly right-down-to-business, plus, he explains “why and what” I should know. My kind of doctor! He does not hesitate to send me to another specialist to get further information  that he then uses to diagnose and compile a treatment plan. I have spent 11 years dealing with stroke symptoms, blood disorder and neuropathy with four  other neurologists but until now, none have taken aggressive or preventive measures like dr Kesserwani. For sure, when I am dealing with life and death issues I want him by my side!

name: Catherine Gilliland
text:
My doctor is David White. He is the absolute best! He always listens to what I say and understands how I am feeling, even if I don't know how to quite describe it. He does yearly and sometimes monthly check ups with frequent EEG's to see my progress.
When I lived in another state, my neurologist would visit with me for 5 minutes tops and NEVER had me do a new test, after 4 years. I was told I was in the same place I stated. But Dr. White has been very helpful and understanding, and now I'm on the road to a possible recovery, and my brain scans are getting better!!
Dr. White and the entire staff here are wonderful people and are always very kind. This is a very wonderful place and I feel so happy to be a patient here!

name: Bob Gorman
text: Dr. Benton has been great to work with.  She has followed up and answered any questions and concerns I have had.  I have not had lengthy wait times for any visits.   All of my prescriptions have been updated on time.

name: Megan Rimkus
text: My doctor was Dr. Benton. I do not recommend this doctor for many reasons. She did give me what I believe is my correct prescriptions for my migraines but I had to jump through hoops for that. I do appreciate the fact She makes sure to get blood work and tests done first. The problem is on multiple occasions Dr. Bentons office has called to move up or reschedule my appointment so she can go home early.  She is also not able/ licensed to do some of the in office procedures. Dr White has a better bed side manner and does the in office procedures.

name: Dennis Borden
text:
My appointment was fine with Dr. Benton and on my second appointment I was told I needed to have my B-12 tested. I never got a call so I won't worry about it.
But after i received the last statement, I tried calling the office to pay over the phone. I tried for 2 days and there was no answer. I attempted to send an email and the Crestwood Hospital website came up. I attempted to pay online and the sample form displayed was nothing like my statement. Something is wrong at this office.

name: Torei Phillips
text: Love this place! If it hadn’t been for Dr.Benton I never would have know about serious health issues I was having. She is very understanding and you can tell she’s Passionate about what she doses! I would recommend this place to everyone!

name: Lisa Carter
text: Today I'm miffed because I rushed across town to get my Mom to her 8:15 AM appointment on time only to find out that they'd moved locations!!!!  No one in scheduling bothered to tell me or were patients notified of this change!  That longgggg recording should first say, our NEW location is ......!  How easy would that be?!

name: Christopher Davis
text:
I made my appointment earlier in the year and spoke with Dr Benton, very nice and requested and MRI. The first problem, cancellation and re-schedules pushed the MRI to April and I finally received my scans. According to Dr Benton I was supposed to have an appointment three weeks later to go over my scans. I called and was told it was rescheduled, glad to know I wasn’t notified, so the virtual meeting was supposed to happen in May.

May came and went, I called again, “oh if there was something in your scan she would’ve called, no news is good news”. Really! Because I’m still having problems that concern me and they have yet to be addressed and once again a reschedule. This time, they said well, she’s backed up until July. Are you serious? Here it is July, the end of July and crickets again..

I should’ve went with my first inclination and drove to Nashville. The front office makes or breaks a Doctors office, it seems they could care less about patient care or advocacy.

name: Scott And Melanie Tidwell
text: Dr. David White is the BEST. Very personable and friendly - but even better: he's incredibly KNOWLEDGEABLE! He listens to questions and complaints/issues and talks through possible treatments. I HIGHLY recommend him!

name: Katrina Craze
text: Dr. White is the best. He is attentive and works hard to help resolve the issues you’re being seen for without wasting your time. Best neurologist I’ve seen.

text: Waits and scheduling are absolutely ridiculous. They stack folks on top of eachother and cause the scheduled appt time to be about 30-45 minute wait after… also it is not convenient to get to AT ALL. The reception never answers the phone so forget rescheduling if you miss an appt.

name: Joyce Gladney
text: I saw Dr. David White and was very impressed with him. He thanked us for coming. He was very nice and polite. He was concerned about my situation and was ready to get to the bottom of my problem. I do believe my family doctor sent me to the right place to get the answers I need.

text: Absolutely horrible service. Misdiagnosed me and when you try to call, they’ll put you on hold indefinitely before just hanging up on you entirely.

text: I have always had wonderful care from Dr. Benton! Shes helped me learn my triggers for migraines and find great ways to cope with them and get into good routines that help prevent and lessens the pain that comes with them! My quality of life has drastically improved since I began my treatment with the wonderful staff and physicians at Neurology consultants of Huntsville!!

name: Debi Barnes
text: i do not understand!? I went to my scheduler dr appt on a Friday around 3:00pm and was there later than 5pm. I did not get my driver license and insurance card back from the office staff. I called Monday first thing in the morning to have them mail it to me. It should not take more than one day to get to me-i do not live in another  country! I had to pay for parking since i was there so late and I could not get back there through the week during working hours since i work long hours. I called the next Friday to find out where it might be and if these cards had even been mailed. I was notified that they are pretty sure they went out late wed. If you know you did not mail them to me when i asked you to do so, do not ask me if I went and had my lab work done yet - your office wont see me with out those items so i cant get lab work done without them either.  The staff could be nicer and actually do as they say. If they tell me they will mail them right out on Monday morning-it should be done. Just FYI-they surely got their co-pay right off the bat! they better hope i get them in the mail over the weekend-otherwise i am requesting them to pay to get me another driver license. I can easily get duplicate insurance card.

text: I love seeing Dr. White, but the office staff is terrible. I tried to make an appointment for two weeks and was constantly told that someone would call me back. I had to call everyday for a week in order to get an appointment. After my appointment my pharmacy told me that they had called the office multiple times regarding issues with my meds and no one responded. I called them for the pharmacy and nothing has been done. At this point I’m looking for a new neurologist.

name: Jessica Hunt
text: My husband has seen her twice, now mind you he's had about 6 appointments! She cancels last min and does not call to tell you she's canceling, my husband missed 4 hours of work one time to drive 45 mins to get to her office and her rude Secretary tells him that she has to reschedule the appointment. But then she expects you to pay her if you don't call 24 hours a head of time to cancel it! She canceled one time because she was out of town, and another because she had court. One time when my husband went she didn't even talk to him she was on her computer or cell phone the whole time! Now because of the meds she put him on has put him in the ER like her voice recording says to do, the ER did nothing for him told him to call his doc and now I have called her 33 times and left a message, my husband has called her 42 times and left a message. You can't get anyone, you call once and you get a busy signal then call again and it rings to her voice mail! She's pathetic and we will NOT be going back!

text: I have been a patient at the office for 5+ years. Holly Cluck is amazing and has been so helpful with everything. I am also now seeing Dr Reddi for Botox injections and am very happy with him also. The only downfall is when you are trying to reach someone to schedule or change an appointment. This has happened to me several times now, they NEVER answer the phone and it goes to the voicemail. They say that you will be called within 48 business hours and it doesn’t happen. I have actually had to drive to the office to make an appointment. It happened again today so I’m hoping by writing this review it will help.

resp.text: Thank you for the positive review and feedback! We are honored to serve the River Region with excellence in healthcare and appreciate your insight, as always.

name: Troy Rhoades
text:
Have been using BN for years. Have used Dr. Leushke & Jessica Adair for nerve conduction study for carpel tunnel & sleep apnea. Both are very professional, listen intently & explain everything completely & I would recommend either for your needs. I go to church with Dr. Green & regard him very highly, even though I have never been a patient. However, today I had my 1st visit with Dr. Chin for concerns with possible memory loss. Not really sure how happy I was with the visit. I really thought there would be more diagnostic study & evaluation, but the only diagnostics was a couple of very simple & rudimentary questions and I was not very impressed. He spoke a lot (& the COVID mask didn't make our communication very easy), listened a little but didn't seem all that engaged and seemed to discount my concerns. He did schedule me for a brain MRI. Don't get me wrong, he was very nice but I left the exam feeling lacking. Maybe once the MRI is completed & I go back for my followup visit, things will improve. My family has had issues with dementia and memory loss, and I may not be exhibiting signs right now, but my family physician and I agree that establishing a "baseline" would be essential for any future issues....
I will revise my review at that time if warranted.

resp.text: Hi, Troy. We would value the chance to connect with you further. At your convenience, please reach out to our patient care team at 334-747-7250. Your feedback is important to us and we look forward to speaking with you.

I called to get a refill of medication 11 times in 6 days and nobody called me back. Running out of medication means I could have a seizure, if I have a seizure I lose my drivers license, if I lose my drivers license I can’t work, and if I can’t work I can’t support my home.

Aside from poor communication of the office, the doctors are good.

These are some of the rudest people l have ever encountered. You cannot get anywhere with anyone in person, or on the phone. They like to hide behind the phone so they can continue to be rude and then put you on hold for so long in hopes that you will hang up.

I understand there is construction going on, but why would you allow them to park their machinery or put their supplies in the handicap spots. Handicap parking is already limited, especially van accessible spots.

text: I've had constant pain for years now and because I'm young the doctors feel "uncomfortable" trying more serious treatments even though I'm losing my whole life to this pain. On top of that when they reply to reviews they copy and paste the same message over and over again. They are not listening to me and they won't listen to you. They don't care.

The billing and customer service department of the group believe that I got what I deserve and the doctor is correct. And force me to find another doctor and the cost of losing everything because of they don’t care.

text: If you want to waste your time using this Dr's office then this is the place for you! I have NEVER in my life dealt with a medical office with such poor service. I had one nurse who called me back after 4 days and she tried to tell me she knew exactly what the Doctor had ordered me to do with a certain medication and when i ask her how she knew, she tried to tell me she was in the room with the Dr. which I called her out on because she wasnt in the room with the dr and I. A lady by the name of Jordan was, this ladies name was Gloria! When I confronted her and told her NO MA'AM you were not in the room Jordan the dr and myself were the only 3 people in there that day, she put le on hold and later came back to the phone with a different attitude, but informed me that my Dr was out of town and guess what HE HAD NO FILL INS.. I have worked in the medical field and bo that Drs cant just leave their patients without ANYONE to help them with their medical needs!! Long story short I went without my medication from Thursday until the following Thursday! 7 FULL DAYS!! It was no big deal to this lady at all!! I have gladly found another physician and I honestly wouldn't take my animals to this office!! So again if you want to deal with getting the run around THIS IS YOUR PLACE, IF NOT DONT BOTHER EVEN MAKING AN APPOINTMENT!! I will be reporting this medical office!! Thanks for wasting my time Alabama Medical Group!! Maybe dr Rubenstein needs to stick with being the mayor and retire at being a physician!!!

name: Janet Newburn
text:
I don’t normally write online reviews, but this group is terrible.  The Doctor’s and staff are nice, but lack professionalism. I see Rubinstein at the Saraland location and Siegel at the Springhill location.
The wait times are off the charts. When you ask why you are waiting so long, they either just look at you or push you to another waiting area. My time is just as important as theirs. I was at the Saraland location today for over 2 hours. I saw Rubinstein for approx. 4 minutes. Routine checkup.
The staff has not the first clue about what’s going on medically with patients.  I have been called with incorrect information regarding my results, I have had to tell them what they were supposed to be doing per visit with Doctors.  I have been scheduled for a procedure that was ill prepared then I was forgotten.
Office Managers, are you reading these reviews?
Patient care should come first and far most at all times.  The staff in these offices should be more concerned with this than what they are having for lunch.
I walked out after seeing Rubinstein today after I was left sitting to have blood drawn. (I know how long it takes to draw blood)
I’m sure they couldn’t care less! Sooner or later this junk is going to catch up with y’all.

text: I am so very thankful to Dr. Jonathan Siegel and his wonderful staff. Each person was extremely helpful, professional, and caring to me, from the initial consultation with Dr. Siegel, to follow up after my procedure.

name: SHANTA EDWARDS
text:
This is the worst group in the Bay Area PERIOD!! I was turned away because I couldn't pay $110 on a previous bill that didn't even belong to the Dr I was seeing! I made arrangements on this bill and have been paying monthly but this DR refused to see me still!! All the money that I've paid and my insurance have paid and this is how I'm treated!!! I'm not asking for special treatment, just trying to be treated!

I am in severe pain and I am ashamed for this group that they would care more about money than they would helping care for their patient! What kind of medical practice does this!!!!! Only money hungry ones. I will NEVER come back to this establishment nor will I recommend them to anyone. I am going to share this story on social media as well, to let people see how these practices are letting patients suffer because of the almighty green dollar. It is not right nor is it fair. I could see if I had NEVER paid them anything, but to pay every month even with me not even working, makes this situation not only sad but despicable and down right disheartening.  Thanks so much Alabama Medical Group and your doctor's for always putting money first over patients!!!!!!!!!!!

resp.text: Hi Ms. Edwards, on behalf of Alabama Medical Group I apologize that you feel this way. I've spoken with the customer service rep who assisted you today and I have reviewed your file and there seems to be some inaccuracy's with your statement that I'm hoping we can clarify. If you will please call our office at 414-5900, our operations manager would like to discuss your visit in further detail. Thank you and we look forward to hearing from you soon.

name: Kaitlyn Franklin
text: These doctors are the most neglecting, ill mannered doctors I have ever come across and not to mention horrible communication and listening skills. And then they’ll continue to pass you around to many other doctors because they don’t have the means to help. My family and I decided to pull from this doctors office today. Never again.

name: Deanna Davis

Front desk staff does leave a lot to be desired as they are young and tend to be rude and impatient, but you're not there to see the 'staff' so just blow it off.

text: Waited two hours for my mother to see a doctor for a scheduled appointment. Then the front desk was very rude. Never apologized for the two hour wait. They are overbooked. Shouldn’t have to wait all day for appointment.

With that being said, we never want our patients to be unhappy and we apologize for the unpleasant experience. If you would like to discuss this matter further or if we can reschedule your mothers appointment, please call 414-5900 and ask to speak with our operations manager and she will get her scheduled.

name: R.Allen Crowe
text: So I just retired from the United States Navy after 28 years of service.  My family and I moved to Mobile, Alabama for our last move as we intend to live here for the rest of our lives.  Well as in any place you live there are many good things and there are not so good things that you experience.  We just came across a not so good thing and that is the Alabama Medical Group, P.C.  We were only with this PCM and the medical group for 3 or 4 months when we received in the mail a letter from them dismissing one of my family members.  The letter did not state any reason why only that they “need to do this from time to time.”  When asked why our family member was dismissed their representative would not provide a reason and on top of that they were rude during our phone conversation.  As a Navy Captain (retired) who has been to many places in this world along with my family who have been with me through all of that,  this has been the most disappointing experience of my career and was upsetting for my family members.  As a result of this,  my entire family has now changed PCMs.  I hope this feedback will help the management of Alabama Medical Group to self reflect and make some changes for the better. In the meantime,  I would not recommend this facility if you are a veteran as I assume they do not hold the veteran status as important.  That is strictly my impression.

resp.text: Capt. Crowe, I've looked into the situation involving your wife's experience at our practice and due to HIPAA compliance regulations there is very little I can comment about her visit and post publicly on the internet. It's unfortunate to hear that she had a negative experience, and I would like to encourage her to call our office at 414-5900 and ask to speak to the operations manager or the marketing director so we can discuss the allegations in your comments above. One comment that I can, and would like to address, is your statement saying that we do not support veterans. That simply is not true. In fact, several of our physicians currently serve in the military, along with members of our staff, as well as their spouses. We appreciate their service to our country along with yours and the other men and women who chose to make that sacrifice to protect and serve our great nation.

name: Trevor Clifton
text: I may be partial, but Alabama Medical Group is the best practice in Mobile! I will definitely continue to use my physician and the organization for any needs that they are able to assist with.

name: June Reddix-Stennis
text: Just left the Alabama Medical Clinic Walk In Clinic, I was refused service first because it was 4:15pm but the Facebook page says the close at 5pm and the website says they close at 4:30pm, either way I got there at 4:15pm so she said they couldn’t see me because they cut off at 4:15! Then she asked if my primary doctor was in the group, my response was no but I have two specialist in the group, so she then informed me that they couldn’t see me because I didn’t have a primary doctor there. The website says nothing about having to already have a primary there! Either she was lying or the website is giving out bad information! I just drove all the way from west Mobile to go to the walk in clinic and couldn’t even walk in! Wow! I’m sooo disappointed, someone really needs to correct this problem, it’s so unprofessional and so was she! My visits with my specialists there have been great but the Walk in Clinic needs work!

name: Nikita
text:
I’ve now only been twice to this neurologist. Referred by my primary. He has started me on a nerve medicine which some what works. A nerve conduction test was done, it was normal. An mri was done, I had to be called back for more imaging only to hear its “normal” yet after 9 doctors now, they still can’t seem to find anything when you can certainly look at my leg and tell there is NOTHING normal about it. I feel like I’ve lost half of my leg and no idea why or how. Can’t lay on it, if I sit certain ways it’s worse, I can feel internally I’m “sitting on something” that doesn’t belong there. It’s strange. I had to repeat myself 3 times to him,  to get the point that it’s coming from my leg and not my back (during my first visit)  But every test appears to come back normal. How?? I’m hoping I can get Answers soon because sadly this has been going on for over a year. 2 diff dermatologist, 2 diff neurologist, primary, OBGYN, TOC AND SPORTSMED. And no one can figure it out????? I’m running out of hope in the medical field, I’m tired of having to call to hunt down answers, and really just want to be heard by the right doctor because no one seems to know the “right doctor” to handle this per their area of profession. I’m not sure if I need to try ortho next or not. I just need answers not just medicine.
If I could post pictures of my leg on this thread I would.
Thanks!

name: Kendra Leslie
text: The first time I went, I talked to interns almost the whole time. They were really nice but when he came in he didn’t really talk to me at all. I want a doctor who asks questions and listens. All he practically told me was to not drive which I told him I haven’t drove in years and he continued to tell me three more times. I told them what medicine my old doctor had me on, and explained how it was the only one that worked for me. He immediately prescribed me the generic form, and it made my seizures SO much worst that I had to quit taking it. I was having seizures back to back, I was tired 24-7 which doesn’t help, and I was angry a lot. Another problem, is that he didn’t even run tests to see if I was having seizures (I know I was and still am but I feel like a doctor should run tests before giving you a medicine). Well, I left and came to my next appointment. When I showed up to the office, the people at the front decided to tell me that I didn’t need to show up, after I waited in the lobby for an hour. They said it was accidentally made and that they tried calling me to tell me but they called my old number that was on my old doctors records from years ago. They didn’t even look at the new paperwork I gave specifically for them for my new number to tell me not to come in and I had to leave work and miss time. That’s when I stopped my medicine and didn’t go back.

name: patty smith
text:
Horrible is the only word I can come up with now. After numerous trips to Huntsville Hospital ER and to Mr Alipati- he doesn’t deserve to be called a dr. -for over a year - but I would tell them it looked like he was having a stroke- but never did anything not even a simple little ultrasound that would have clearly showed no blood (except small little squirts from little arteries that his body has made on its own- On June 1,2019 my husband was at work in Augusta and suffered a massive stroke- the ambulance to him to Augusta University Medical Center- where they immediately put a stint in in his left coratid artery - this was Saturday- by Monday the stint had not worked and they rushed him back in on Monday night with no success. Our only hope now is a graft- if he gets strong enough .
So for a solid year that man told him that what he was experiencing was nothing but stress related seizures  and put him on seizure medication
I just want to scream- MALPRACTICE

Jessica Vincent, MD

name: Chris Rawlinson
text: My fiance started having migranes 6 months ago after a car accident. All this sorry excuse for a Dr will do is give you medication after medication..and a nerve block....which none of it ever worked. And months have passed with migranes everyday and watching her suffer. She never wanted to order more tests or even try to find out what's causing them. My fiance passed out at work from a migraine and was rushed to the ER via ambulance last week  so we immediately made another appointment with Dr Sanders  she didn't even act concerned that she passed out which is absolutely not normal  instead she just tried to give her another medication to see if it will work. We didn't expect her to be a miracle worker but we did expect her to actually care about her patients which it's obvious she doesnt. She didn't seem the least bit concerned. We expressed our concerns at our last visit with her about all the medication she keeps prescribing and her response was "if you don't like it don't come back." So we will never waste our time and money and will never return. Do yourself a favor and see another doctor don't waste your time and money on this Dr that takes the lazy route by throwing prescriptions at you instead of actually trying to fix the problem while billing your insurance company for tons of money. The bottom line is we have no problem with her being honest and upfront and saying that she has no clue but give it some one prescription after prescription after prescription and having to wait a month in between prescriptions when none of them work is ridiculous and it's very cruel to the patients if we at least saw some effort and concern on her behalf she may have been headache free by now. Praying the next Dr we see gets her better.

text: Dr Sanders is a wonderful neurologist, However the other Dr in with her (Vincent) is a pitiful excuse for a neurologist. She spent a whole 30 seconds with my son after his test. name: Awilda Pena
text: Great doctor...Excellent neurologist!

name: Kayla Raines
text: Dr. Curtis J. Rozzelle helped make it possible for me to live a normal life. I had epilepsy for 17 yrs and in 2010 he performed brain surgery that would forever change my life. August 26, 2020 will mark a decade since my surgery and being seizure free. Because of this surgery I was able to go to school and became a nurse. I have been a critical care nurse for almost 2 years and my next step is CRNA school. I am so thankful to be able to help those at there lowest just like Dr. Rozzelle and the team did for me. Thank you Dr. Rozzelle!!!

name: Shonda Cost
text: Although Dr. Rozzelle isn’t our daughters  primary neurosurgeon, in two different emergency hospital admits he has performed several shunt, drain placements, and two revision surgeries on her. He’s very professional, straight to the point (which we admire), and will do all he can to help your child. We also feel he’s very personable, he’s just all business first which should be expected. We love Children’s of Alabama and are very thankful for the knowledge and professionalism from all we have had encountered over the years. We have a Child of Children’s-12 years and counting.

name: Monster Babe
text: He's straight forward and honest. He will do what's best for your child and tell you why and what to expect. Grateful for him and his staff. Jenna is on top of things like no other nurse I have met.

name: Danielle H. Walker
text: Very honest and knowledgeable! Him and his staff took very good care of my baby boy. My son had two surgeries one at a day old (Encephalocele)  and one at 2 months (shunt for hydrocephalus). Dr. Rozzelle is the best! We  appreciate and respect him so very much!

name: Sarah Martin
text: As parents we can only do so much to help our children and we rely on the professionals to do what we cannot...HELP THEM!  He did not do this for my child.  After a two minute visit of him not wanting to answer any questions, he dismissed us and walked out.  I am currently seeking an opinion from an out of state doctor and will never go back to the Neurosurgery department at Childrens.

name: Donna Robbins
text: Love Dr Dorene Morris n her staff BEST DR WITH A LOVING CARING SOUL LIKE NOBODY ELSE ! WOULDNT USE NO ONE ELSE !

name: Tim Elam
text: Dr. Karr and his staff are very professional and courteous. Dr. Karr has genuine concern and takes the time to listen to his patients. Highly recommended.

name: Roberta Birch
text: This is the facility where patients go for all labs and testing. Even if  you think you have an appointment, it doesn't stand. You put your name on a list when you get there. I had an appointment for a test, got down there from Florence, and they were closed! There was a severe weather warning for the county they're in, but I didn't know as I don't live in that county and didn't hear any warning. No phone call. No sign on the door. No answer to phone calls inside, no answering machine or service. They just stand you up.

name: Susan McClain
text: Be prepared to wait over an hour or two past your appointment time to be seen by your provider.  The office is dirty.  Receptionist/office workers are not very friendly. The appointment times are overbooked.  Very disappointing.

name: Cathy Pham
text: This place is absolutely horrible. They always over book patients. The average wait time is 1.5-2 hours. It doesn’t matter if you get there late or early, you’ll always end up waiting for at least 1 hour. It’s ridiculous. Don’t brother with this place unless you want to spend most of your day napping in their waiting room.

name: Tracy Stubblefield
text: My dad saw dr ridgeway. Love him! Well worth the wait. What a gem.  He answered all of my dads and my questions with total patience. 🙏🏼

name: Ann Shortis
text:
Disorganized,fired too many experienced staff leaving mostly young inexperienced staff. Expect long waits from over booking patients.We waited almost 2 hours on more than one occasion due to staff inability to triage patients,forgetting to sign patients in on arrival,not allowing appropriate time for new patients to be seen.Just to name a few.
Also,for months we have heard "our fax machine is old and doesn't work right". I suspect the staff cannot trouble shoot or even work it if the "go" button doesn't work the first time..or it is an extremely old machine that needs replacing and no one wants to spend money on it..faxes have mysteriously gotten "lost" far too often  to be just an accident. We have to go in person and stand at the counter and complain to get anything for another Dr to see.
The technician/Drs who read the CT results are 100% unreliable. 2 ct's can read wildly different even within a couple of days of each other. The X-ray situation is soso.
Staff with minimal in house training take the various scan,ultrasounds etc  and readings..

Mainly,it's a crapshoot on care here.Which has gotten much worse since our Dr died in a 4by4 accident.
I say avoid if at all possible

name: TSR Consulting
text: I continue trying to call Dr. Liotta but no one answers the phone. Kinda hard to see my PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIAN when you dont answer the phone. Not happy about this.

name: Sir Thomas
text: Only giving one star because it’s required. I’ve been going here for years and this place has turned into a crackhouse... Going to this doctor  office (regardless of which doctor you see) is like going to a new restaurant on opening day, expect complete chaos and everything sucks!

name: James Gasque
text: This office is completely unorganized. They never return my calls and never provide critical information to their patients. I'm absolutely amazed that they manage to retain any patients at all.

name: Jaz N
text:
Staff doesn't LISTEN, they're RUDE, AND YOU WAIT FOR HOURS To see a Dr who barely listens to you for 5 min. I've called 3 times about a referral.
While I was waiting for my second appointment the front staff stopped doing ALL work to ARGUE with each other about why paperwork isn't done.
I've been to two appointments where both times Dr L has sent in a referral to me. I've been back to the Dr twice and the incompetent staff hasn't helped me. I'm in pain and the dr honestly doesn't know what this is. None of the medicine has helped.

UPDATE: This post is from 3 days ago. I called TWICE yesterday about the same referral. I was told I would get a call back, apparently my referral was transferred to a different Dr in their office. Still no call back; I called back again to get the voicemail.
ISO new primary care physician

name: Jessica Jones
text: Its sad when the people at the front desk are very rude and are too worried about partying after work. I had to get a school excuse (so my sister could go back to school that day) for my sister and she wouldn't give us one and made us wait for 15 minutes for a peice of paper. The people in the back were amazing they were kind and generous.

name: Christina Roberson
text: My mother goes to this practice and her Dr is awesome, but the office part is unorganized, rude, and plain unprofessional. It makes you wonder how in the world the people at the front desk even got their degree or if they are educated. It is a nightmare to try to get a refill on a medication. It's impossible. The only way to get them is when you actually see the doctor.. if you forget to get a refill when you see the doctor well your screwed until the next month basically. We live about a hour away from there so we can not just go by there everyday trying to get one refill. Today I called about a refill and have been trying to get this refill now for over a week and eventually instead of helping me they hung up on me. I just am beyond aggravated. My mom really likes her dr and his nurse is so sweet, but it's getting to the point that I'm seriously considering finding her another doctor bc of the fact everything about the front desk is just so unprofessional. When we gofor my mother's appt I'm going to complain about this and try to get a number that is a direct line to my mom's Dr or his nurse. I advise anyone who's thinking about coming to this practice to find another Dr office. It you are a new patient it's not worth the hassle

name: Felicia Wise
text: Great staff, great  doctor, they really listen to you and take all precautions and does test on site!

name: robert foshee
text: Dr. Ridgeway is the best at patient care.. he listens and lets you talk and doesn't cut you off!!

name: David Little
text: Your gonna spend at least 4 hours to see a doctor for 5 minutes  I quit going I got tired of going up there and they couldn't give me a answers for any problem I was having. All they care about is when you coming back to pay them some more money again at Shoals Primary Care

name: Janice Nix
text: They are professional, and have patience. They really work with you to get your health in order.

name: K
text: At 19 years old I became a patient of Brad Ginevan MD. After my current pediatrician, Dr. Rivas, advised it was time to transition to an adult provider. During the time he was my provider, Dr. Ginevan worked alongside my psychiatrist to continue maintenance of my ADHD and when necessary, he worked with specialists to manage my delicate GI condition. This included references to appropriate clinics and scheduling of applicable tests ie. Colonoscopy, EGD, etc. I truly trusted Dr. Ginevan and was incredibly grateful to have found such a wonderful physician. I never minded the fact that his office was always moving locations or that his appointments had become a nightmare to secure. I still referred only my closest of friends and family to see him. Always assuring them they'd be nothing less than satisfied with him as they're provider. Those were the old days... in 2013 I moved away to live on base with my then husband. I moved back in 2015 and returned to Dr. Ginevan. He and his staff had undergone a complete restructuring as they were now a part of the mega-merger trend and had merged with the tri-cities health giant Shoals Primary Care LLC. Due to the merger Dr. Ginevan no longer had any of my previous medical records from all of my time spent under his care which led to massive complications to my continuity of care. (I now understand the importance of my responsibility to secure medical history documentation and maintain my own current updated personal medical record.) Also, SADLY, due to the implementation of a governmental-esque standard of operating procedures, it is my opinion that Dr. Ginevan no longer maintained the level of patient care he had became known for. His office staff has always been grade-A; to be commended. If you are considering seeing Dr. Ginevan as your primary care provider this review is for you. In closing I want to say that this review in no way, intends to slander or cause malice. This review is my personal experiential reference/opinions of Dr. Ginevan meant solely for the purpose of socially informing fellow peers.

name: Shelby Stanford
text: Most of the staff is nice but they are very unorganized. Too many hands touching paperwork

name: Dawn Wheeler

He is very professional, courteous, and extremely intelligent, most of all, he is thorough . DR SYED  will perform tests needed to evaluate your concerns .In my opinion, he IS the best

name: Kimberly Heupel
text: I have seen many Drs from all over and these Drs has done a complete work up on me I am at Dr now and shoals primary Care has all the Drs you could need in this building I'm very pleased with them and they have their own machines here so you don't have to go to the hospital for any kind of scans  I give them 5 stars

name: Diamond Love
text: Dr Karr is a wonderful doctor.  He really cares about his patients well being.

name: Em Means
text: I had planned to start seeing Dr. Martin as a new patient after my husband's first visit (where they had down on his chart that he was a 60 year old female with impacted bowls). I ignored that fact and still decided to give the doctor the benefit of the doubt because I could understand things sometimes happen. However, upon my scheduled visit as a first time patient it was for 7:30 am, and I arrived at 7:15 am for new patient paper work. I signed in and no one even showed up at the front desk until my appointment time, where I  then asked for my paper work and filled it out. About ten minutes after that, another woman called me by the wrong name and when I corrected her, I was made to feel as if I had done something wrong. Also, you can not hear when you are being called because the TV is loud, so people are talking over the TV, and I have two ear infections. After filling out my paper work, I was then called back to the window, where I was asked to write down my SSN, but I had already written it down twice on the form already. This told me they obviously were not paying attention to the information they were entering. After this, and already feeling on edge from just the front desk experience, I am called back by the doctor's nurse practitioner who tells me to step on the scale, and with a horrible tone says, "you're going to have to take some of that off." Meaning my purse. I ask where I should put it in case of a designated area, which seem to make her even more annoyed and she replies with, "I don't know." Very snappy. I am a new patient and felt like I was asking a very simple and non offensive question. We then walk to the exam room where she informs me that I would not be seeing the doctor and that he also would never been doing my exams or ever seeing me other than a quick peek in the room. Which, as someone looking for a long term doctor, it does not feel comfortable not even meeting my doctor on the first visit. When I tried to explain that I was uncomfortable with the fact she would only be relaying my issues to the doctor, and that I didn't feel comfortable having my health looked after in third person, and that I didnt understand why they wouldn't tell a new patient to begin with when making an appointment that he or she won't be seeing a doctor. She then got upset about it and told me I could reschedule or abort because she had been doing this for 40 years. Which is fine and I explained to her I was fine with her seeing me, but that I didn't feel comfortable having a doctor diagnose me without speaking with me and knowing me as a person. She gets more upset and I said I think it would be best just to cancel because at that point, being someone who has been diagnosed with a generalized anxiety disorder, I was overwhelmed and ready to go home. She proceeded to then say to me, "Fine then. Adios." I feel as if the entire situation was unprofessional on many different levels. I decided to keep searching for a new doctor. I would not advise this practice if you want to get to know your doctor for long term use, or have anxiety issues, seeing as how it is the only doctor's office I have ever been in where the lobby is loud and over packed.

name: Shamea C
text: I really like Dr. Ridgeway alot, I've been seeing him for over 5 years. He is an excellent pulmonologist, but his front desk ladies are really very rude..

name: Martin Painter
text: Dr. Karr is the best doctor I’ve ever been with!!!

name: Samantha Smith
text: Well where do I start.... First I guess I could start off with the fact the receptionist are very rude. Next I am being seen by Dr Aaron karr aka his assistant for a blood clot in my liver. So as I'm being processed for my visit the nurse asks me." Ma'am which side is your blood clot on".........eeerrrmmm. unless I have 2 livers it is on my right side. I over looked that. NEXT , I go in for my inr check and my levels are still below standard so he send me to Hellen Keller to do bloodwork and says he will call with the results. No call..... Instead I call up there later in the day and she says you need to come pick up you medicine. So I go get it they have switched my medicine with no telling me no nothing I am a breastfeeding mother. He switched me to a medicine that I cannot breastfeed on without any consultation. I had to Google the risks and side effects. Totally unprofessional and a headache. I will be switching doctors asap!

text: His staff could be more friendly.  When you're going to talk about your seizure disorder your already feeling uncomfortable.  So,  try to be more friendly. It says a lot about the office.  Doctor is very knowledgeable and explains very well!

name: Kelli Brock
text:
Very pleased with my mom’s visit on Thursday. We were pleasantly  surprised with hardly a wait and all staff were very nice. Dr Kar seemed genuinely interested in finding out how to help my mom and explained the tests he ordered and what they were looking for with the results. Would highly recommend and have already shared my experience with my coworkers.
Thanks,
Kelli

name: Jessica Sisco
text: Dr. Kar is very thorough. He is not afraid to keep testing before he can give you an answer. Multiple people across the medical field sang his praises when I told them he was my neurologist. His staff are helpful and kind and appointments are quick.

name: Jennifer Epperson
text: I work in healthcare as a nurse practitioner and I have been very impressed by Dr. Kar! I have suffered with random symptoms for nearly 10 years now and have seen numerous specialists over the years but no one could figure out what was wrong with me. He is the most thorough physician I have ever been to and he kept pursing answers/running tests until he determined what was going on. He not only accurately diagnosed my problem but he keeps working to find a treatment regimen that is appropriate for me. He is extremely intelligent and takes the time to sit down and explain things in detail. I would highly recommend Dr. Kar! He has forever changed my life and I’m so grateful for him!!!

name: Jessica Gulley
text: Dr. Kar made me feel like he was truly concerned about my illness and assured me that we would get to the bottom of what is going on. He is very thorough and seemed to genuinely care. I would definitely recommend Dr. Kar to anyone needing a neurologist.

name: Jaded Gal
text:
Great doctor and office staff, rarely do these two meet. My mother started suffering falls 2 + years ago & her primary doctor referred her to Dr. Kar, I am so glad he did.

The office staff contacted me quickly to set up the appointment, got my mother in to see Dr. Kar in less than a month & Dr. Kar, he’s great, really nice man. He swiftly ordered tests to discover the reason for her falls. There has not been a long drawn out period of waiting. After her major fall in February, we started discussing with her doctor what was wrong and causing this after her release from the hospital. Our first appointment was the end of April and I feel like they are closing in on the issue and soon her quality of life will be improved. Dr. Kar and his staff are great, really good experience.

name: Mark Witt
text: Excellent visit - Dr. Kar is very knowledgeable and provided very good advice and recommendations to treat my migraines.

name: Chris Taylor
text: I’ve been three times to this office and every time has been pleasant. The dated and Dr. Kar are very friendly and I never have to wait over 30 mins. Great place if you need a neurologist!

name: Janet Johnson
text: Dr Kar was kind and patient and listened to my issues/concerns.   Was happy with visit.

name: Carol G.
text: Didn’t have a long wait; all employees were polite and professional, Dr. Kar was very knowledgeable and friendly. I had a very good experience at Neurology Institute of Huntsville.

name: Judy Strange
text: I thought Dr. Kar's staff was very pleasant.  I was impressed that Dr. Kar listened to any concerns I had and plan to follow up on my primary care physician's questions.  He seems to be a very kind and conscientious physician.  He said he takes the Hippocratic oath seriously.

name: ronda thrower
text: Dr. Kar and his staff are very professional. He listened closely and seemed very concerned for my well being. I would definitely recommend him.

I had my 1st visit on March 24, 2021. They are all Professionals and took time to answer all questions and concerns I had. It's so hard to this kind of treatment from Office Staff all the way to  Dr. Kar.
Dr. Kar takes the time to  answer concerns,  questions and I feel confident that he can help me!

name: Susan Mueller
text: Dr Kar thoroughly explained tri-geminal neuropathy and showed me medical drawings of the facial nerves and area of the brain sending the jolts. Because it is the second time I have experienced these severe electrical jolts to my face, he ordered an MRI to see if anything is going on in the brain to cause it.  Of course, he prescribed medication to stop the painful jolts.  He saw me on the weekend which was absolutely wonderful.

name: Kristi Ware
text: Dr. Hudgens is amazing! He was caring and considerate. He got to know me before my symptoms!! So happy he is my doctor.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words and this wonderful review!

name: Cyndy Kiel
text: Great doctor...great staff. They really care!

resp.text: Our staff strive to provide the best care and experiences. Thank you for your comment!

name: Marie Copeland
text: Dr. Hudgens is one of the sweetest and kindest doctors I know. He is always caring and genuinely cares for his patients. He gets to the root of the issue and initiates the best plan of care. Thank you for always being therefor me. Migraines are so debilitating and can take over ones life. I pray we find a cure soon. Thank you always

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words and this wonderful review!

name: Henry Ricks
text: Good supporting staff, through review of current health, and medication verified for treatment.

resp.text: Our staff strive to provide the best care and experiences. Thank you for your comment!

name: Regina Fisher
text: Wonderful and caring doctor and staff.

resp.text: Our staff strive to provide the best care and experiences. Thank you for your comment!

name: Lola Bennich
text: Dr. Hudgens took time to get to know me before he even started addressing my problems. He was very thorough during the exam and answered all my questions.  He left me feeling hopeful and optimistic about my future.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review; we are happy to pass along your comments to Dr. Hudgens.

name: Clyde Greene
text: I had an excellent experience as a new patient of Dr. Hudgens.

resp.text: Thank you; we appreciate your feedback!

name: Bruce Cooperman
text: Great doctor, great staff !!!

resp.text: We strive for 100% satisfaction, and we love to hear about these positive experiences! Thanks for your review.  We hope to be of service to you again in the future.

name: Anna Peters
text: I give him 5 stars. The website does not reflect what I intended. He is a wonderful doctor.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the positive review!

name: Malinda Teasley
text:
Dr. Hudgens is the best neurologist!! He is so kind and cares so much treats you as family. I thank God for him and his wonderful staff. He and his nurse were a true blessing to me and has been so helpful with my situation.
Wish you all a Happy New Year and many blessings. I can’t give him enough stars 🙏🙏

resp.text: Malinda Teasley, thanks for your praise and kind comments about our team. We always strive to provide top quality service and are pleased to hear that your experience has been a good one! Thank you again for taking the time to let us know how we did. We hope you have a great day!

name: Wayne Scott
text:
Dr. Hudgens is a dedicated doctor.
He genuinely cares for his patients and their families. He is dedicated and knowledgeable in his field of medicine.
He is dedicated to the healing of the  whole person, both physical and spiritual.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words and this wonderful review!

name: testing testing
text: I was very pleased. Dr. Hudgens and staff are very professional, yet make you feel at ease.

name: Sunni Knight
text: He knew of a new way to help my migraines. So far so good. He didn't have to even guess why half my arm was going numb. He told me and told me what I needed to stop doing. And he listens. And he actually smiled at me. Silly I know but it helps when you're scared.

resp.text: Sunni Knight, thank you for sharing your positive experience!

name: Lou Bush
text: Dr. Hudgens is the best Dr. I have ever met. He is knowledgable, shows genuine concern and has an excellent bedside manner. I am a nurse-23 years and have encountered so very many. Not one of them is near as good.  He is the Gold Standard.

resp.text: Lou Bush, thank you for your kind words and this wonderful review!

name: April Tee
text: Simply put, Dr. Kyle Hudgens is amazing. Battling epilepsy is one of the most difficult issues I've ever experienced. When I felt like giving up, he kept my family & I pushing. And I can't wait until we go to Africa next year (inside joke), Lol!!! God Bless all.

resp.text: April Tee, thank you for your kind words and this wonderful review!

name: Lenora Neal
text: Such a knowledgeable man and has a very caring attitude!!

resp.text: Lenora Neal, thank you for your kind words and this wonderful review!

name: Michael French
text: Dr Kyle has taken care of my mom and I have known him for years. He is an amazing doctor and even a more amazing man.

resp.text: Michael French, thank you for your kind review; we are happy to pass along your comments to Dr. Hudgens and his team.  Thank you again for leaving us this response!

name: halie fortner
text: I am not a pt of Dr Hudgens, however my mother is. My mother suffers with chronic pain related to her neuropathy. Dr Hudgens, has been a professional and caring doctor to my mother. But there is a disconnect between the staff and how information is relayed in the office. My mother currently has been out of her maintenance medication for 2 days. Multiple messages left, and she and I both have spoken to staff. In which staff states 24-48hrs. When asked if there is no other way to relay a message, staff state no. Staff that are in the same building as nurses and physicians,  but the only way they can relay a message is through a computer system that you may hear back from within 24-48 hrs. For someone who is in chronic pain such as my mother and takes a maintenance medication just to function daily, this is beyond upsetting. When asked to speak with the clinical manager, it was stated she was out of the office. I am a hospice nurse and strive to take care and provide comfort for my pts. Daily I deal with doctors offices and setting up pain management for my pts. Never have a dealt with an office that may or may not reply within 24-48hrs. The individual I spoke with today showed no empathy toward my mother or her plight. I hope by reading this, management will address the issues that are so very prevalent from an outsider looking in.

resp.text: Halie Fortner, thank you for bringing this matter to our attention. We regret that you had a negative experience and will use this as an opportunity to improve. We would like to address your concerns. In order to do so, I will need to know your mother's name.  Please email me at leisha.harris@grandviewhealth.com or call my direct line at 205-971-4926.  Thank you, and we look forward to hearing from you.

name: Cc Dd
text: Old school bedside manner, very sincere, thorough.

name: Maria Smith
text: Always professional, courteous, and caring.

resp.text: Maria Smith, thank you for your kind words and this wonderful review!
